com.avaya.ic.sdk
Interface EmailDraft

All Superinterfaces:
Document, DraftDocument, EmailMessage
public interface EmailDraft
extends DraftDocument, EmailMessage

Used to send an outbound email. EmailDraft is a type of draft document.

Nested Class Summary
static class EmailDraft.Operation
           
static class EmailDraft.OperationFailed
          Indicates that the asynchronous operation failed.
static class EmailDraft.OperationSucceeded
          Indicates that the asynchronous operation succeeded.
static class EmailDraft.Type
          Defines different email draft types.

setCharSet

void setCharSet(java.lang.String charset)
Set The character set used in the body of the EmailDraft. By default, the charset used is the same as the inbound EmailDocument. The CharSet must be explicitly set for new outbound email drafts.

Parameters:
charset - The character set used in the body of the EmailDraft. By default, the charset used is the same as the inbound EmailDocument. The CharSet must be explicitly set for new outbound email drafts.

getEmailDraftType

EmailDraft.Type getEmailDraftType()
Get The type of the email draft.

Returns:
The type of the email draft.

getOutboundAccount

java.lang.String getOutboundAccount()
Get An outbound email account. You can retrieve a list of available outbound accounts from the EmailChannel.

Returns:
An outbound email account. You can retrieve a list of available outbound accounts from the EmailChannel.

setOutboundAccount

void setOutboundAccount(java.lang.String outboundaccount)
Set An outbound email account. You can retrieve a list of available outbound accounts from the EmailChannel.

Parameters:
outboundaccount - An outbound email account. You can retrieve a list of available outbound accounts from the EmailChannel.

addAttachment

Attachment addAttachment(java.lang.String filePath)
Adds an attachment to the current EmailDraft.

Parameters:
filePath - The full path to the attachment file in the local file system, including the file name.
Returns:
The Attachment object that was added.

getAttachment

java.io.InputStream getAttachment(java.lang.String attachmentId)
Retrieves an attachment that was previously added to the EmailDraft. The returned stream must be read until end of file (EOF) and explicitly closed, or the operation results in exceptions on the server. Usually, the exception generates a message such as "Connection reset by peer" which is a very generic TCP error.

Parameters:
attachmentId - The unique id of the attachment to be retrieved.
Returns:
The binary stream that contains the attachment.

setContent

void setContent(java.lang.String content,
                EmailMessage.ContentType contentType)
Sets the content which becomes the message body. The content can be plain text or HTML. You must pass the proper content type to indicate whether the content is HTML or plain text.

Parameters:
content - The content of the EmailDraft.
contentType - The MIME-type of the content.
